TopicTitle: What is the name of the currency?

Articles.Content:
Is there a name for the currency used in KSP? It looks like "\F" in some of the screens and like a square root symbol in other places.

What's it called?
"Funds". That's it, and it is indeed a square root symbol that's got a few extra bits on it for stylization.

Ã¢Ë†Å¡Funds.

No, seriously. They're called 'Ã¢Ë†Å¡Funds'.

I'd have preferred an actual currency name, really.
for a friend of mine and me, they are "wurzel(n)", german for the mathematic symbol of the root. translated to english, that would be something like rooties. ;-)
Official name is funds. Feel free to call it whatever you want though. I like Kerbits personally ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Roots. As in square root? Little green men? No? It just me than...
I go with roots, people seem to know what I'm on about ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I've just consulted the book of knowledge ([http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_circulating_currencies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_circulating_currencies)) and a few amusing "K" prefixed possibilities present themselves.

Perhaps Squad have something in mind for future versions?
